text: Lieutenant General William Keir "Bill" Carr, CMM, DFC, OStJ, CD (March 19, 1923 â€“ October 14, 2020) was a Canadian Air Force officer. He was called the father of the modern Canadian Air Force. He was born in Grand Bank, Dominion of Newfoundland. He became Deputy Chief of the Defence Staff in 1973 and the first Commander, Air Command in 1975 before retiring from active duty in 1978.Keir Carr William Keir Carr Canadian Aviation Hall of Fame Carr died on October 14, 2020 at the age of 97. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Canadian military personnel of World War II Category:People from Newfoundland and Labrador
title: William Keir Carr
